instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Macbook no audio after fell down
threads.message:
I got a macbook A1286 having no audio sound through the speakers niether through the audio socket.
the device fell down while the audio jack was plugged and has damaged the board where the audio socked is located.
a number of pads were cut.
i ve restored those pads but without success.

threads.title: Macbook no audio after fell down
Macbook no audio after fell down
threads.message:
Hello Dukefawks;

Thanks the problem is solved concerning the sound coming from the speaker. This was my quickest fix, :) . I understand that the Audio chip according to this change gets not anymore a signal from the audio Jack that it is plugged (while it in fact is not). 

Can you confirm from this that by changing the socket will the headset problem also be solved or you think that the problem can also on the PCB pads too?

Greeting

threads.title: Macbook no audio after fell down
threads.message: No idea. If the headphone works and speakers work it is fixed. R6805 is only needed for SPDIF to work so who cares about that?

threads.title: Macbook no audio after fell down
threads.message: Will this mean that the headphone also will work? I still didn t checked it. I thougth by removing the R6805, the headphone will be disactived! Can you explain if I m wrong? What the the role is of SPDIF

threads.title: Macbook no audio after fell down
threads.message: H/P should work, only SPDIF will not work.

threads.title: Macbook no audio after fell down
Macbook no audio after fell down
threads.message: Probably a bad trace damaged component. Just check them all, no other way to fix this.
